title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Loading R packageImporting DataUnderstanding data


First, load R packages using the below code:

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)



The code chunk below imports exam_data.csv into R environment by using read_csv() function of readr package.

exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")




head(exam_data)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
First, load R packages using the below code:

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, readr)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
3.1 Bar plot

Bar plot



ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x= RACE)) +
  geom_bar(alpha= 0.5) +
  labs(x = "Race",
       y = "Number of Students",
       title = "Race distribution of Exam Data")+
  theme_classic()+
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
3.2 Histogram

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,
                 color="black",
                 fill="light blue")




:::

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
4.1 Working with facet_wrap()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= SCIENCE)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_wrap(~ GENDER)+
  theme_bw()

title: In-class Exercise 1: Now You See It!
text:
In this hands-on exercise, two R packages will be used. They are:

tidyverse, and
haven

The code chunk used is as follows:

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, haven)

title: In-class Exercise 1: Now You See It!
text:
In this hands-on exercise, two R packages will be used. They are:

tidyverse, and
haven

The code chunk used is as follows:

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, haven)

title: In-class Exercise 1: Now You See It!
text:
2 Importing PISA data
The code chunk below uses read_sas() of haven to import PISA data into R environment.
Step 1: Use read_sas() to read SAS file

stu_qqq <- read_sas("data/cy08msp_stu_qqq.sas7bdat")

Step 2: Filter required data using filter()

stu_qqq_SG <- stu_qqq %>%
  filter(CNT == "SGP")

Step 3: Save filtered data in R Data Format

write_rds(stu_qqq_SG,
          "data/stu_qqq_SG.rds")

Step 4: Read saved R Data format file to ensure that it is working

stu_qqq_SG <- read_rds("data/stu_qqq_SG.rds")
